alert.note: Alert for Dale; Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Dale and northern Henry Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 345 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Gaino to Texasville to Clio. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Edwin, Otho, Scottsboro Crossroads, Double Bridges, Roberts Crossroads, Graball, Screamer, Coates, Clopton, Thomas Mill Creek, Phillips Crossroads, Dykes Crossroads, Lawrenceville and Abbeville Municipal A/P. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
